Submodules¶

indic_aug.align module¶

class indic_aug.align.Aligner(model_type, iters, max_tokens=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to perform bitext word alignment using the IBM Models.

Constructor method.

Parameters

  • model_type (str) – Variant of IBM Model to use, one of (‘ibm1’, ‘ibm2’, ‘ibm3’).

  • iters (int) – Number of iterations to train the model.

  • max_tokens (int, optional) – Documents with number of tokens greater than max_tokens will not be used for training, pass None to use all documents, defaults to None.

align(src_sent, tgt_sent)[source]¶

Given a sentence in the source language and a sentence in the target language, outputs the values of the alignment function from words in the target sentence to words in the source sentence.

Parameters

  • src_sent (str) – Source sentence

  • tgt_sent (str) – Target sentence

Returns

Aligned sentences

Return type

nltk.translate.AlignedSent

align.Aligner

plot_alignment(src_sent, tgt_sent, font_family, figsize=(7, 5))[source]¶

Given a sentence in the source language and a sentence in the target language, plots the values of the alignment function from words in the target sentence to words in the source sentence as a heatmap.

Parameters

  • src_sent (str) – Source sentence

  • tgt_sent (str) – Target sentence

  • font_family (str) – Font family to be passed to seaborn.set_theme. Recommended are any of the relevant Sangam MN fonts for MacOS.

  • figsize (2-tuple) – Size of generated heatmap.

Returns

Aligned sentences

Return type

nltk.translate.AlignedSent

Runs training iterations of IBM Model.

Parameters

  • src_input_path (str) – Path to source parallel corpus.

  • tgt_input_path (str) – Path to target parallel corpus corresponding to above source corpus.

indic_aug.globals module¶

Module to contain variables that are required in multiple places.

indic_aug.globals.LANGS¶

List of supported languages.

indic_aug.globals.INVALID_CHARS¶

List of characters that need to be removed from the raw corpus before using any augmentation. Remove all tabs and double quotes as they clash with the implementation.

indic_aug.globals.SENTENCE_DELIMS¶

String of pipe (|) separated characters on which to split a document into sentences.

indic_aug.globals.PAD_TOKEN¶

Token to use for padding sentences.

indic_aug.globals.PAD_ID¶

Index corresponding to PAD_TOKEN.

indic_aug.globals.UNK_TOKEN¶

Token to use for unknown words.

indic_aug.globals.UNK_ID¶

Index corresponding to UNK_TOKEN.

indic_aug.globals.SOS_TOKEN¶

Token to use for start of sentence.

indic_aug.globals.SOS_ID¶

Index corresponding to SOS_TOKEN.

indic_aug.globals.EOS_TOKEN¶

Token to use for end of sentence.

indic_aug.globals.EOS_ID¶

Index corresponding to EOS_TOKEN.

indic_aug.globals.BLANK_TOKEN¶

Token to use for blanking words for some augmentation algorithms.

indic_aug.globals.BLANK_ID¶

Index corresponding to BLANK_TOKEN.

indic_aug.preprocess module¶

class indic_aug.preprocess.Preprocessor(raw_src_path, raw_tgt_path, stanza_dir='C:\\Users\\Deepak\\stanza_resources')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to perform the following: 1. Preprocess input (tokenizing, normalizing) before feeding to sentencepiece. 2. Generate the vocabulary. 3. Replace appropriate words in corpus by special tokens.

Constructor method.

Parameters

  • raw_src_path (str) – Path to raw source portion of parallel corpus.

  • raw_tgt_path (str) – Path to raw target portion of parallel corpus.

  • stanza_dir (str) – Directory where stanza resources are stored. If you have not modified the location where stanza.download downloads its models, then you may leave this parameter untouched (in that case, you will find the stanza_resources directory in your home directory). Refer indic_aug.utils.load_stanza_pipeline for more information.

build_vocab(src_vocab_size, tgt_vocab_size, vocab_dir)[source]¶

Generates vocabulary for source and target parallel corpus.

Parameters

  • src_vocab_size (int) – Number of words in source vocabulary.

  • tgt_vocab_size (int) – Number of words in target vocabulary.

  • vocab_dir (str) – Path to where sentencepiece *.model and *.vocab files to be saved (described in detail in vocab.py).

post_vocab(out_src_path, out_tgt_path)[source]¶

Replaces out-of-vocabulary words with UNK_TOKEN (“postvocab processing”).

Parameters

  • out_src_path (str) – Path to output source corpus after postvocab processing.

  • out_tgt_path (str) – Path to output target corpus after postvocab processing.

pre_vocab(prevocab_src_path, prevocab_tgt_path, batch_size)[source]¶

Processing before vocabulary is built (“prevocab processing”).

Parameters

  • prevocab_src_path (str) – Path to output source corpus after prevocab processing.

  • prevocab_tgt_path (str) – Path to output target corpus after prevocab processing.

  • batch_size (int) – Number of documents to bring into memory at once.

Returns the word in freq_dict that has the closest frequency to that of word.

Parameters

  • freq_dict (dict) – Word to frequency mapping as returned by vocab.freq2dict_vocab.

Returns

Word with closest frequency to that of word.

Return type

str

indic_aug.utils.cyclic_read(filepath)[source]¶

Returns a generator which can read the same file line by line (lazily) arbitrary number of times.

Using open to read a file will raise StopIteration once EOF is reached. cyclic_read will instead loop back to the start of file and continue reading indefinitely. Note that it also strips newline characters (both ‘\n’ and ‘\r’) before returning the line.

Parameters

filepath (str) – Path to input file.

Usage

Say you have a file sample.txt which contains the text

lorem
ipsum
dolor

then calling cyclic_read on sample.txt would look like:

>>> for line in cyclic_read('sample.txt'):
...     print(line)
lorem
ipsum
dolor
lorem
ipsum
dolor

and so on indefinitely.

indic_aug.utils.doc2sents(doc, lang)[source]¶

Splits a document into sentences. Wrapper around nltk.sent_tokenize and indicnlp.tokenize.sentence_tokenize.sentence_split.

Parameters

  • doc (str) – Document to be split into sentences.

  • lang (str) – ISO 639-1 language code of doc.

Returns

List of sentences in doc.

Return type

list(str)

indic_aug.utils.doc2words(doc, lang)[source]¶

Splits a document into words. Wrapper around nltk.word_tokenize and indicnlp.tokenize.indic_tokenize.trivial_tokenize.

Parameters

  • doc (str) – Document to be split into words.

  • lang (str) – ISO 639-1 language code of doc.

Returns

List of words in doc.

Return type

list(str)

indic_aug.utils.fix_split_special_tokens(doc)[source]¶

Tokenizing adds space within special tokens (so ‘<unk>’ becomes ‘< unk >’). This function restores modified special tokens to their normal form.

Parameters

doc (str) – Document in which special tokens are to be fixed.

Returns

Document with special tokens fixed.

Return type

str

Loads a stanza pipeline. If stanza models are not downloaded, first downloads the model to the stanza_dir directory then loads.

Parameters

  • stanza_dir (str) – Directory where to store stanza resources.

Returns

A stanza pipeline

Return type

indic_aug.utils.path2lang(path)[source]¶

Returns language code from extension of path.

Parameters

path (str) – File whose language code is to be extracted. Note that the file must have extension as language code, for example, train.en for English. Refer globals.py for language codes.

indic_aug.vocab module¶

class indic_aug.vocab.Vocab[source]¶

Bases: object

Utility class for vocabulary-related functions.

vocab_dir is a directory containing *.model and *.vocab files as generated by sentencepiece or Vocab.build. The files in this directory must be named as <lang_code>.model and <lang_code>.vocab (automatically done if you use Vocab.build), where lang_code is the ISO 639-1 code for that language. For example, if you were translating between English and Hindi, the directory would be structured as:

<vocab_dir> ├── en.model ├── en.vocab ├── hi.model └── hi.vocab

classmethod build(src_path, tgt_path, src_vocab_size, tgt_vocab_size, vocab_dir)[source]¶

Trains a sentencepiece model and generates the vocabulary.

Parameters

  • tgt_vocab_size (int) – Number of tokens in targert vocabulary.

  • vocab_dir (str) – As described in the docstring for this class.

classmethod score2freq(vocab_dir, lang)[source]¶

Returns frequencies of all words in the vocabulary, reverse calculated from sentencepiece score (negative log likelihood).

Parameters

  • vocab_dir (str) – As described in docstring for this class.

  • lang (str) – ISO 631-9 code for language.

Returns

Map of word in vocabulary to its frequency.

Return type
